title: Acts Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Acts with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 28 chapters.

questions.question: Who was chosen by casting lots to replace Judas Iscariot as an apostle?
questions.explanation: Matthias was chosen to take Judas' place as an apostle after prayer and casting lots.

questions.question: What promise did Jesus instruct the apostles to wait for in Jerusalem?
options: The promise of the Father - the Holy Ghost
questions.correctAnswer: The promise of the Father - the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Jesus told the apostles to wait in Jerusalem for the baptism with the Holy Ghost.

questions.question: According to Acts 2, what sound was heard on the day of Pentecost?
questions.explanation: The sound like a mighty rushing wind filled the house where the apostles were sitting.

questions.question: Who preached the first sermon on the day of Pentecost?
questions.explanation: Peter stood up with the eleven and preached to the crowd explaining the prophecy fulfillment.

questions.question: True or False: The believers in the early church had all things common and sold possessions to distribute to any in need.
What miracle did Peter and John perform at the Beautiful Gate of the temple?
questions.explanation: They healed a man who was lame from birth, who sat begging at the gate.

questions.question: In Acts 4, what was the reaction of the priests and rulers when Peter and John testified about Jesus?
options: They were astonished and commanded them not to speak
questions.correctAnswer: They were astonished and commanded them not to speak
questions.explanation: They were amazed but commanded Peter and John not to teach in Jesus' name.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved, but _________."
Who was the first Christian martyr, stoned to death after his defense before the Sanhedrin?
questions.explanation: Stephen was accused of blasphemy and was stoned after a powerful speech.

questions.question: True or False: Stephen's face appeared like the face of an angel as he was being stoned.
In Acts 8, who evangelized in Samaria and performed many miracles?
questions.explanation: Philip preached in Samaria and many believed, accompanied by miracles.

questions.question: Who baptized the Ethiopian eunuch after explaining the scripture to him?
questions.explanation: Philip was led by the Spirit to meet and baptize the Ethiopian eunuch.

questions.question: What event caused Saul to cease persecuting the church and become a believer?
options: A vision on the road to Damascus
questions.correctAnswer: A vision on the road to Damascus
questions.explanation: Saul saw a bright light and heard Jesus’ voice on the way to Damascus.

questions.question: True or False: Ananias was hesitant but obeyed the Lord to go and heal Saul's blindness.
What was Peter’s vision that led to the acceptance of Gentiles into the church?
questions.explanation: Peter saw a vision where unclean animals were lowered on a sheet, symbolizing Gentiles being accepted.

questions.question: Who was the Roman centurion that Peter visited, leading to the first Gentile conversion?
questions.explanation: Cornelius was a devout Gentile who received the Holy Ghost after Peter’s visit.

questions.question: True or False: The early church in Antioch was the first to call the followers of Jesus 'Christians'.
Which two men were sent out by the Holy Ghost from Antioch for missionary work?
questions.explanation: The Holy Ghost directed the church at Antioch to send Paul and Barnabas for the work.

questions.question: Who opposed Paul and Barnabas on the island of Cyprus, leading Paul to pronounce blindness on him?
questions.explanation: Elymas sought to turn the proconsul away from the faith, and Paul struck him with blindness.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "And as many as were ordained to eternal life believed."
What was the main issue addressed at the Jerusalem Council in Acts 15?
questions.explanation: The council debated if Gentile believers had to follow Mosaic law including circumcision.

questions.question: Who was chosen to deliver the letter from the Jerusalem Council to the Gentile believers?
questions.explanation: Judas called Barsabas and Silas were chosen to accompany Paul and Barnabas.

questions.question: True or False: Paul and Silas were imprisoned in Philippi after casting out a spirit from a maiden.
What miraculous event occurred while Paul and Silas were praying and singing in prison?
options: An earthquake opened the prison doors
questions.correctAnswer: An earthquake opened the prison doors
questions.explanation: A great earthquake shook the prison, opening doors and loosening chains.

questions.question: Who was Lydia in the book of Acts?
options: A seller of purple and a convert in Philippi
questions.correctAnswer: A seller of purple and a convert in Philippi
questions.explanation: Lydia was a merchant woman who believed and was baptized along with her household.

questions.question: Who was the young man that fell asleep and fell out of a window during Paul's preaching in Troas?
questions.explanation: Eutychus fell asleep and fell from the third story but was revived by Paul.

questions.question: True or False: Paul was shipwrecked on the island of Malta during his voyage to Rome.
What miraculous event happened to Paul on Malta that caused the islanders to think he was a god?
options: He was bitten by a viper but unharmed
He raised a child from the dead
questions.correctAnswer: He was bitten by a viper but unharmed
questions.explanation: A poisonous viper fastened on Paul's hand but he was not harmed, amazing the islanders.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "For the which cause I also suffer these things: nevertheless I am not _______."
Who was the Roman governor that Paul appeared before in Caesarea and later was sent to Rome?
questions.explanation: Festus succeeded Felix and heard Paul's case before sending him to Caesar.

questions.question: True or False: Paul was released from house arrest in Rome and continued his missionary journeys freely.
What was the main theme of Paul's message to the Jews in the synagogue at Antioch of Pisidia?
options: Jesus is the Savior and fulfillment of prophecy
The law of Moses must be kept perfectly
A new temple will be built
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus is the Savior and fulfillment of prophecy
questions.explanation: Paul preached Jesus as the promised deliverer and called for repentance.

questions.question: True or False: The apostles performed many signs and wonders through the power of the Holy Ghost.

Fill in the blank: "But ye shall receive power, after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you: and ye shall be _________ unto me both in Jerusalem, and in all Judaea, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth."
Who was Simon the Sorcerer and what did he attempt to do?
options: A magician who tried to buy the Holy Ghost's power
A Roman centurion who welcomed Paul
A Jewish Pharisee who opposed Stephen
questions.correctAnswer: A magician who tried to buy the Holy Ghost's power
questions.explanation: Simon tried to buy the power to bestow the Holy Ghost but was rebuked.

questions.question: True or False: The disciples at Ephesus received the Holy Ghost and spoke with tongues and prophesied after Paul laid hands on them.
What was the outcome of the riot in Ephesus caused by the silversmith Demetrius?
options: The crowd was confused and the town clerk quieted them
questions.correctAnswer: The crowd was confused and the town clerk quieted them
questions.explanation: The town clerk calmed the crowd to prevent further disturbance.

questions.question: What vision did Paul have in Troas encouraging him to go to Macedonia?
options: A man of Macedonia pleading for help
questions.correctAnswer: A man of Macedonia pleading for help
questions.explanation: Paul saw a vision of a man from Macedonia asking him to come and help.

questions.question: Who was the young man whom Paul raised from the dead in Troas?
questions.explanation: Eutychus fell from a window and was brought back to life by Paul.

questions.question: True or False: Paul was acquitted by Felix after his trial in Caesarea and released immediately.
Complete this verse: "And the word of God increased; and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem greatly; and a great company of the priests were _______ to the faith."
